title: How to Make a Short Rib Sandwich

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit (148 degrees Celsius).
Season the ribs with salt and pepper.
Add a couple tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot on high heat.
Place the ribs in the pot and sear them all over their sides for about two minutes.
Remove the ribs from the pot and transfer them to a plate.
Pour in the carrots, garlic, and onions into the pot.
steps.description: Reduce the heat to medium high and stir the vegetables with a wooden spoon for about 1-2 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour in the beef broth and mix.
Transfer the ribs back to the pot and allow it to cook.
steps.description: Cover the pot with a large lid and allow the ribs to cook for about 2-3 hours, until the meat starts to fall of the bones and is quite tender.

steps.headline: Remove the ribs from the pot.
steps.description: Allow them to chill in the fridge until they are cool. The fat will start to congeal on the tops of the ribs.

steps.headline: Get rid of the parts you don't need.
steps.description: Remove the fat off the ribs using a spoon. Discard some of the beef broth.

steps.headline: Reheat the ribs on the stovetop and shred them.
Toast the baguette until it's warm.
steps.description: Then slice down the middle with a knife.

steps.headline: Make the sandwich.
steps.description: Scoop the ribs onto the sandwich and then add the vegetables. Drizzle with a bit of the beef broth.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve the sandwich on a serving plate with a salad if desired. Enjoy!

text: Cooking the Short Ribs Preheat the oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit (148 degrees Celsius).  Season the ribs with salt and pepper.  Add a couple tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot on high heat.  Place the ribs in the pot and sear them all over their sides for about two minutes.  Remove the ribs from the pot and transfer them to a plate.  Pour in the carrots, garlic, and onions into the pot. Reduce the heat to medium high and stir the vegetables with a wooden spoon for about 1-2 minutes. Pour in the beef broth and mix.  Transfer the ribs back to the pot and allow it to cook. Cover the pot with a large lid and allow the ribs to cook for about 2-3 hours, until the meat starts to fall of the bones and is quite tender. Remove the ribs from the pot. Allow them to chill in the fridge until they are cool. The fat will start to congeal on the tops of the ribs. Get rid of the parts you don't need. Remove the fat off the ribs using a spoon. Discard some of the beef broth. Making the Sandwich Reheat the ribs on the stovetop and shred them.  Toast the baguette until it's warm. Then slice down the middle with a knife. Make the sandwich. Scoop the ribs onto the sandwich and then add the vegetables. Drizzle with a bit of the beef broth. Serve. Serve the sandwich on a serving plate with a salad if desired. Enjoy!
